memberdef.name: ESB_DEFAULT_CONFIG
memberdef.initializer: { \ .protocol = ESB_PROTOCOL_ESB_DPL, \ .mode = ESB_MODE_PTX, \ .event_handler = 0, \ .bitrate = ESB_BITRATE_2MBPS, \ .crc = ESB_CRC_16BIT, \ .tx_output_power = 0, \ .retransmit_delay = 600, \ .retransmit_count = 3, \ .tx_mode = ESB_TXMODE_AUTO, \ .payload_length = 32, \ .selective_auto_ack = false \ }

detaileddescription.para: Roughly equal to the nRF24Lxx default parameters except for CRC, which is set to 16 bit, and protocol, which is set to DPL.

memberdef.name: ESB_LEGACY_CONFIG
memberdef.initializer: { \ .protocol = ESB_PROTOCOL_ESB, \ .mode = ESB_MODE_PTX, \ .event_handler = 0, \ .bitrate = ESB_BITRATE_2MBPS, \ .crc = ESB_CRC_8BIT, \ .tx_output_power = 0, \ .retransmit_delay = 600, \ .retransmit_count = 3, \ .tx_mode = ESB_TXMODE_AUTO, \ .payload_length = 32, \ .selective_auto_ack = false \ }

briefdescription.para: Macro to create an initializer for a TX data packet.

parameterdescription.para: The pipe to use for the data packet.
Comma separated list of character data to put in the TX buffer. Supported values consist of 1 to 63 characters.

simplesect.para: Initializer that sets up the pipe, length, and byte array for content of the TX data.

detaileddescription.para: 1 Mb radio mode using Bluetooth low energy radio parameters.

briefdescription.para: Enhanced ShockBurst radio transmission power modes.

detaileddescription.para: Automatic TX mode: When the TX FIFO contains packets and the radio is idle, packets are sent automatically.
Manual TX mode: Packets are not sent until esb_start_tx is called. This mode can be used to ensure consistent packet timing.
Manual start TX mode: Packets are not sent until esb_start_tx is called. Then, transmission continues automatically until the TX FIFO is empty.

parameterdescription.para: Parameters for initializing the module.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or (negative) error code otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Calling this function stops ongoing communications without changing the queues.

parameterdescription.para: If successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

detaileddescription.para: Calling this function disables the Enhanced ShockBurst module immediately. Doing so might stop ongoing communications.

simplesect.para: All queues are flushed by this function.

briefdescription.para: Check if the Enhanced ShockBurst module is idle.

simplesect.para: True if the module is idle, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Write a payload for transmission or acknowledgement.

detaileddescription.para: This function writes a payload that is added to the queue. When the module is in PTX mode, the payload is queued for a regular transmission. When the module is in PRX mode, the payload is queued for when a packet is received that requires an acknowledgement with payload.

parameterdescription.para: The payload.
If successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.
The payload to be received.
If successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.
If successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.
If successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.
If successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

detaileddescription.para: This function clears the TX FIFO buffer.

parameterdescription.para: If successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

briefdescription.para: Pop the first item from the TX buffer.

parameterdescription.para: If successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.
If successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

briefdescription.para: Set the length of the address.

parameterdescription.para: Length of the ESB address (in bytes).
If successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

briefdescription.para: Set the base address for pipe 0.

parameterdescription.para: Address.
If successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

briefdescription.para: Set the base address for pipe 1 to pipe 7.

parameterdescription.para: Address.
If successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

briefdescription.para: Set the number of pipes and the pipe prefix addresses.

detaileddescription.para: This function configures the number of available pipes, enables the pipes, and sets their prefix addresses.

parameterdescription.para: Prefixes for each pipe.
Number of pipes. Must be less than or equal to embed:rst:inline :kconfig:option:`CONFIG_ESB_PIPE_COUNT` .
If successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

detaileddescription.para: The enable_mask parameter must contain the same number of pipes as has been configured with esb_set_prefixes. This number may not be greater than the number defined byembed:rst:inline :kconfig:option:`CONFIG_ESB_PIPE_COUNT`

parameterdescription.para: Bitfield mask to enable or disable pipes. Setting a bit to 0 disables the pipe. Setting a bit to 1 enables the pipe.
If successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.
Pipe for which to set the prefix.
Prefix to set for the pipe.
If successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

briefdescription.para: Set the channel to use for the radio.

detaileddescription.para: The module must be in an idle state to call this function. As a PTX, the application must wait for an idle state and as a PRX, the application must stop RX before changing the channel. After changing the channel, operation can be resumed.

parameterdescription.para: Channel to use for radio.
If successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.
Channel number.
If successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.
Output power in dBm. The esb_tx_power values can be used to provide backward compatibility.
If successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.
Delay between retransmissions.
If successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

briefdescription.para: Set the number of retransmission attempts.

parameterdescription.para: Number of retransmissions.
If successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.
Radio bitrate.
If successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

briefdescription.para: Reuse a packet ID for a specific pipe.

detaileddescription.para: The ESB protocol uses a 2-bit sequence number (packet ID) to identify retransmitted packets. By default, the packet ID is incremented for every uploaded packet. Use this function to prevent this and send two different packets with the same packet ID.

parameterdescription.para: Pipe.
If successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.
